column41: Materials: enamel Measurements: 8.27 in. (21.00 cm.) (height) by 6.50 in. (16.50 cm.) (width) Size Notes: frame 50 cm x 42.5 cm Description: after Correggio Markings: signed lower right HBone, the reverse inscribed London April 1811 Painted by Henry Bone R.A. Enamel painter in Ordinary to His Majesty and Enamel painter to His R.H. the Prince Regent after the Original by Correggio in the possesion of Captn Stevenson - Painted for George Bowles Esq.; within an ormolu surround engraved ENAMEL HBONE; frame with partial printed label inscribed VENTA PARCIAL Col. ANTONIO SANTAMARINA and inscribed with ink 107 and circular label inscribed in ink no. 1267 H. Bone, the backing inscribed in ink after Correggio Henry Bone no. 15 Berners Str London and with circular label inscribed no. 1267 H. Bone. Literature: John Preston Neale, Views of the Seats of Noblemen and Gentlemen: in England, Wales, Scotland and Ireland, 1826, III, The Honourable Anne Rushout, Wanstead Grove, listed in the Library, South Side. Jones, Views of the Seats, Mansions, Castles, etc. of Noblemen and Gentlemen, 1829, Wanstead Grove, Essex, The Hon. Anne Rushout, listed in the Library, South Side, p. 4-B2. J.J. Rogers, 'Notice of Henry Bone, RA, and his works, together with those of his son, Henry Pierce Bone, and of other members of the family', Journal of the Royal Insitution of Cornwall, 1880, VI, no. XXII, p. 301. John Preston Neale, The Mansions of England, vol. I, 1847, p. 4-B2. Provenance: Purchased by George Bowles (d. 1817) of The Grove, Wanstead, Essex. Bequeathed to his niece, The Hon. Anne Rushout (d. unmarried 1849) and recorded still in her possession at The Grove, Wanstead in 1847. Probably bequeathed to her nephew Sir Charles Rushout Rushout, 2nd Bt. (1809-1869) of Sezincot House, Gloucestershire and by descent to his son. Sir Charles Fitzgerald Rushout, 3rd Bt. (1840-1879); probably sold Phillips & Son, London, Valuable Property Removed from Sezincot House, Gloucestershire by Order of the Executors of Sir Charles Rushout, Bart, December 9, 1879. Galerie Charles Brunner, Paris. Antonio Santamarina (1880-1974), sold Adolfo Bullrich, Buenos Aires, Venta Parcial de la colecciA3n Antonio Santamarina, October 3-5, 1955, lot 107

Literature: Bibl.: S.Bellesi "Andrea Scacciati. Pittore di fiori, frutta e animali a Firenze in etA  tardobarocca" FI 2012, p.117 n.27 e 28. Provenance: Sotheby's Milano, 2007; collezione privata. Queste straordinarie tele sono da collocarsi, per la loro grande qualitA , al periodo di piena maturitA  dell'artista. Collocabili, per analogie stilistiche ed esecutive con alcuni dipinti licenziati dallo Scacciati, all'inizio degli anni Ottanta del Seicento. Degno di menzione per raffronti A  il "Vaso in metallo dorato con fiori" firmato e datato 1682 apparso a Londra da Sotheby's nel 1997.
